metadata.Title: CVE-2023-28366 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: The broker in Eclipse Mosquitto 1.3.2 through 2.x before 2.0.16 has a memory leak that can be abused remotely when a client sends many QoS 2 messages with duplicate message IDs, and fails to respond to PUBREC commands. This occurs because of mishandling of EAGAIN from the libc send function.

notes.Note: gianz> Memory leak requiring refactoring of core functions to be fixed. Applying the patches to versions < 2.0.0 is likely to cause regressions.

criterions.comment: mosquitto: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
